description: Performance benchmark baseline thresholds for ActionRunner self-hosted runners. These values represent minimum acceptable performance for typical CI/CD workloads.

DiskIO.description: Disk I/O performance thresholds for build artifacts and workspace operations

Network.description: Network performance thresholds for GitHub API and artifact downloads

notes: Baseline values are derived from typical CI/CD workload requirements
DiskIO: Based on SATA SSD minimum performance (100 MB/s write, 150 MB/s read)
Network: Assumes reasonable internet connection with GitHub API access
DotNet: Simple console app build should complete in under 30 seconds
Python: Startup and simple script execution for basic CI tasks
Git: Small repository clone (e.g., github/gitignore) should complete quickly
These baselines should be reviewed and adjusted based on actual runner environments
Performance grades help categorize runner quality: Excellent (production-ready), Good (acceptable), Adequate (minimum viable), Poor (needs improvement)
